Member Function Documentation

CMenuBar * CPlot2DWindow::addMenuBar ( )
 

Because of the integrated menu functionality, a menu bar has to be created by this function. The function returns a pointer to the menu bar. The menu bar can also be accessed from derived classes by using the data member d_menuBar. A call to one of the following menu functions automatically creates a menu bar and a menu "View"

void CPlot2DWindow::addAllViewMenuItems ( )
 

Adds all items that are described in the next functions

void CPlot2DWindow::addMenuItemsForLegend ( )
 

Adds menu item to control the legend position

void CPlot2DWindow::addMenuItemsForGrid ( )
 

Adds menu items to switch the grid on and off

void CPlot2DWindow::addMenuItemsForStatusBar ( )
 

Adds menu items to switch the status bar on and off

void CPlot2DWindow::addMenuItemsForZerolines ( )
 

Adds menu items to switch the zerolines on and off

void CPlot2DWindow::addMenuItemsForDoubleBuffering ( )
 

Adds menu items to switch the double buffering on and off

void CPlot2DWindow::addMenuItemsForAxisScaling ( )
 

Adds menu items to have axis scaling

void CPlot2DWindow::addMenuItemsForCurveHighlightingFromLegend ( )
 

Adds menu items to control if curves are highlighted when moving the mouse cursor over the legend

void CPlot2DWindow::addMenuItemsForCurveHighlightingFromCurve ( )
 

Adds menu items to control if curves are highlighted when moving the mouse cursor over the curve itself

void CPlot2DWindow::addSeparator ( )
 

Adds a separator to the view menu

void CPlot2DWindow::setStatusBarOn ( )
 

void CPlot2DWindow::setStatusBarOff ( )
 

int CPlot2DWindow::isStatusBar ( )
 

Controls if a status bar is visible. The status bar displays information about the element the mouse cursor is pointing at

void CPlot2DWindow::setCurveHighlightingFromLegendOn ( )
 

void CPlot2DWindow::setCurveHighlightingFromLegendOff ( )
 

int CPlot2DWindow::isCurveHighlightingFromLegend ( )
 

Controls if curves are highlighted when the mouse moves over the legend

void CPlot2DWindow::setCurveHighlightingFromCurveOn ( )
 

void CPlot2DWindow::setCurveHighlightingFromCurveOff ( )
 

int CPlot2DWindow::isCurveHighlightingFromCurve ( )
 

Controls if curves are highlighted when the mouse moves over the curve itself

void CPlot2DWindow::drawPlot ( )
 

Fully draws the plot. Call this method and not Plot2D::drawPlot, as this method updates the scrollbars

void CPlot2DWindow::updatePlot ( )
 

Draws changes since last draw. Call this method and not Plot2D::drawPlot, as this method updates the scrollbars

void CPlot2DWindow::applyPlotSettings ( )
 

After settings have been changed directly in the CPlot2D object, call this function to have the menu items and the axis scaling dialog reflect these changes.

void CPlot2DWindow::setBackgroundColor ( PgColor_t backgroundColor )
 

Sets the background color of the plot window and the plot

PgColor_t CPlot2DWindow::getBackgroundColor ( )
 

Gets the background color of the plot window and the plot
